title: North Wales Coast Family Fun
tagline: Easy access adventure from the A55
suitableFor: Families with children aged 8 and up who enjoy moderate physical activity and exploring historical sites. Those comfortable with heights will especially enjoy Zip World.
notSuitableFor: Families with very young children (under 5) or individuals with significant mobility limitations or a strong fear of heights. Those seeking challenging hikes should consider other itineraries.

stops.title: Zip World Fforest Coaster
stops.description: Experience the thrill of a gravity-driven toboggan run through the forest. Great fun for the whole family.

wetAlt.title: Bounce Below at Zip World Llechwedd
wetAlt.description: Jump and play on giant trampolines in a disused slate mine.

budgetAlt.title: Gwydir Forest Park Walks
budgetAlt.description: Explore the beautiful Gwydir Forest with various walking trails suitable for all abilities. Parking charges apply.

stops.title: Hangin' Pizzeria Betws-y-Coed
stops.description: A popular pizzeria with delicious wood-fired pizzas and a relaxed atmosphere.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Llyn Ogwen
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy stunning views of Tryfan while having a picnic by the lake.

stops.title: Conwy Castle Exploration
stops.description: Discover the impressive medieval fortress of Conwy Castle, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

wetAlt.title: Plas Mawr Elizabethan Town House
wetAlt.description: Explore a well-preserved Elizabethan townhouse in the heart of Conwy.

budgetAlt.title: Walk the Conwy Town Walls
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy panoramic views of Conwy and the surrounding area from the historic town walls. Free access.

stops.title: The Castle Hotel, Conwy
stops.description: A charming hotel in the heart of Conwy, offering comfortable rooms and a convenient location.

budgetAlt.title: Conwy Touring Park
budgetAlt.description: Camping and caravan site with good facilities, a short drive from Conwy.

stops.title: Great Orme Tramway
stops.description: Take a scenic tram ride to the summit of the Great Orme, offering stunning coastal views.

wetAlt.title: Llandudno Pier Arcade
wetAlt.description: Enjoy classic seaside arcade games on Llandudno Pier.

budgetAlt.title: Hike the Great Orme
budgetAlt.description: Walk up the Great Orme via various trails, enjoying the coastal scenery (wear good shoes). Parking charges may apply at the base.

stops.title: Home Cookin' Llandudno
stops.description: A cozy cafe serving homemade lunches, cakes, and coffee.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch on the beach
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own sandwiches on Llandudno's North Shore beach.

stops.title: Welsh Mountain Zoo
stops.description: Discover a variety of animals from around the world at this popular zoo with stunning views.

wetAlt.title: Small World Theatre
wetAlt.description: Catch a family-friendly show or workshop at this intimate theatre in Cardigan

budgetAlt.title: Bodnant Garden (National Trust)
budgetAlt.description: Explore the beautiful Bodnant Garden with its stunning terraces and plant collections (National Trust membership required or admission fee applies).

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: The North Wales coast can experience variable weather, even in summer. Pack layers and be prepared for rain. Coastal winds can be strong.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic along the A55 can be heavy during peak season, especially on weekends. Allow extra time for travel. Parking in Conwy and Llandudno can be challenging; use park-and-ride services where available.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Advance booking is essential for Zip World activities, especially during school holidays. Consider booking accommodation well in advance, too. Conwy Castle tickets can be booked online.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This itinerary involves moderate walking, especially on the Great Orme and around Conwy Castle. The Fforest Coaster is suitable for most fitness levels.
